5_1JdoX9KdJeRVjN9zvK8N9C5jybEHzZe8n.body:
I know this is terribly old, but just wanted to add that "type" can be used to quickly check these things. For example:

>>> type(os.path)
<class 'module'>
>>> type(os.path.exists)
<class 'function'>

As you can see, *os.path* is  a module, and *os.path.exists* is a function within that module.
